Armstrong.Action: Maintains intense focus and composure despite severe turbulence and overwhelming sensory input in the cockpit.
Performs technical checks and operates controls methodically during a high-stress flight.
Calmly hits a switch and maintains focus despite the plane shaking violently and being knocked across the cockpit.
Uses understatement ('Protocol is off. Little bumpy.') in a highly dangerous situation, showing confidence and control.
Does not immediately respond to heart rate warnings, choosing to remain detached and focused on the task.
Successfully ignites the rocket and controls the X-15 through violent acceleration and high G-forces, making precise adjustments at extreme speeds and altitudes.
Maintains focus on critical flight instruments despite violent shaking and odd mechanical noises.
Ignores an odd mechanical whine during a critical phase of flight.
Fails to notice the plane isn’t turning and altitude is climbing, indicating a critical oversight.
Remains calm and focused despite the emergency, switching to reaction controls skillfully.
Keeps calm and focused on altitude gauge despite disorienting upside-down flight.
Struggles with the stick under extreme G-forces but manages to flip the plane right-side up.
Communicates clearly and promptly with ground control about his situation.
Acknowledges the dire situation realistically and attempts to glide the powerless plane as far as possible.
Quickly reacts to the ventral fin being on, hits the ventral button to blow it off despite the plane pitching forward, showing situational awareness and decisiveness.
Struggles with the stick as altitude drops rapidly, indicating difficulty maintaining control under pressure.
Follows Butch's instructions promptly, deploying flaps and managing to keep the plane just above obstacles, demonstrating skill and responsiveness.
Successfully executes a rough but controlled landing in extremely challenging conditions, using back fin brakes to slide the plane to a stop, showing high competence and control.
Initially annoyed at himself for leaving the ventral fin on, showing self-awareness but also a momentary lapse in preparation.
Successfully manages a dangerous plane landing with a controlled slide, bringing the plane to a halt despite violent shaking and difficult conditions.
Makes detailed notes in his logbook after the flight, showing thoroughness and attention to detail.
Suggests replicating the unusual atmosphere bounce in the simulator, demonstrating analytical thinking and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Methodically straightens the sheets and carefully glues a wing on a model plane, showing precision and calm focus.
Reluctantly stands when the doorbell rings, indicating a momentary pause in his focused activity but no loss of control.
Avoids discussing Karen's condition and shows emotional denial about leaving for Gemini or Apollo missions, suggesting a lack of emotional readiness or avoidance.
Hugs his family close and tight at the funeral, showing physical support despite his own grief.
Endures condolences and soft pats on the back quietly, showing tolerance and composure.
Is impassive and does not cry at the funeral, potentially indicating emotional distance or difficulty expressing warmth.
Slips away from the funeral early, possibly avoiding social interaction and support.
Maintains detailed, organized medical and scientific notes, carefully tracks radiation levels, and thoroughly researches experimental treatments, showing determination and methodical study.

Does not outwardly express grief at his child's funeral, appearing impassive and slipping away from condolences, which could indicate emotional detachment or difficulty processing grief, potentially a negative impact on interpersonal competence.
Carefully stacks away Neil's papers and books after use, showing respect for others' belongings.
Leaves early in the morning without waking Janet, possibly to avoid disturbing her.
Focuses intently on work despite social awkwardness with colleagues, showing dedication but limited social engagement.
Carefully stacks all marked up medical books and scattered papers away on a high shelf after thorough study.
Wakes up early, already awake before the alarm, showing discipline and readiness.
Immediately engages colleagues to discuss technical data on the bounce, showing initiative and focus.
Refuses to take days off despite suggestion, indicating strong commitment and confidence in his work.
Glances at the memo, contemplates the challenge, eyes the diagram with curiosity and absorption, then reaches for the memo to engage with the problem.
Hums quietly during isolation, showing calmness and mental steadiness under stressful conditions.
Circles the statement 'It takes a lot for me to get angry' on a personality test, indicating emotional control and self-awareness.
Endures extreme physical discomfort (ice water in ear, foot in ice bath turning white and then blue) without reacting or giving up.
Maintains focus and mental resilience during painful tests, continuing to respond and engage despite suffering.
Draws a generic stick figure of himself and hesitates when asked to draw his family, showing some emotional or psychological struggle.
Bangs on the door to get out after enduring the tests, showing determination and control rather than panic.
Shakes hands politely with panel members but shows no visible enthusiasm or warmth.
Responds succinctly and factually to John Glenn's attempt at friendly conversation, creating an awkward atmosphere.
Engages seriously and respectfully with technical questions from the panel without dismissiveness.
Confidently shakes hands with senior panel members without showing intimidation.
Does not boast about his Navy combat pilot experience despite its relevance.
Responds succinctly and thoughtfully to technical questions about Lunar-Orbit Rendezvous, showing understanding of complex issues.
Maintains a reserved and somewhat awkward demeanor in social interaction, not engaging warmly with others.
Wraps his arms around Janet out of habit, attempting to bridge the emotional divide despite his unresponsiveness.
Remains largely unresponsive and emotionally distant during family supper after tragedy.
Identifies key technical challenges such as cislunar navigation, designing the lunar excursion ship, and rendezvous and docking, demonstrating clear understanding of complex mission requirements.
Makes a darkly humorous but serious comment about the difficulty of getting men back, showing awareness of mission risks and a confident grasp of the situation.
Appears emotionally distant and unresponsive during a family moment, focusing on the night sky rather than engaging with loved ones, indicating possible emotional detachment or distraction.
Sits attentively taking copious notes during a detailed briefing on Soviet space achievements and U.S. plans, showing focus and analytical mindset.
Remains analytical and intent despite grim atmosphere around him, indicating confidence and skill in processing complex information.
Takes copious notes alongside other astronauts, showing preparation and focus.
Displays trepidation when introduced publicly, indicating some nervousness.
Appears uncomfortable and halting when answering a question in front of the press, showing stiffness and lack of ease.
Attempts to answer thoughtfully about the challenge and alignment with national goals, indicating some level of understanding and seriousness.
Engrossed in marking up a thick binder labeled GEMINI, does not look up as Janet enters.
Remains totally calm and composed during the rocket liftoff while others are anxious and nervous.
Engrossed in marking up a thick technical binder labeled GEMINI, showing focus and dedication to his work.
Pat offers cookies and invites neighbors over despite their recent move, aiming to create company and ease tension.
Pat quickly recovers from Janet's embarrassment and disappointment, maintaining a friendly and warm demeanor.
Ed appears uncomfortable with the visit, suggesting a lack of enthusiasm or warmth in social interactions.
Janet flushes, embarrassed and disappointed but Pat doesn’t miss a beat and smoothly continues the conversation, setting Janet at ease.
Neil struggles to analyze the spin in the multi-axis trainer but actively grabs the controls and clicks several times, showing engagement and effort to manage the situation.
Persists through intense physical challenge, insists on continuing despite nausea and difficulty.
Closes his eyes and uses inner ear awareness to control the spinning machine, successfully stopping it.
Falls and vomits after the test, showing physical limits.
Shows concern and anxiety while watching the underwater egress training, clenching his hand and scanning the situation carefully.
Does not intervene immediately when Deke hesitates during the rescue, instead watches and waits.
Steadies himself after dry heaving and controls his physical reaction despite being visibly unwell.
Shows concern and focus during the flotation tank emergency, scanning the situation carefully and clenching his hand, indicating attentive and composed behavior under stress.
Does not take immediate physical action during the flotation tank emergency, instead observing and waiting for rescue efforts, which could be seen as either prudent or passive depending on context.
Responds promptly to Deke's command to suit up, indicating readiness and discipline.
Struggles physically with the centrifuge test, showing signs of physical strain and vomiting afterwards.
Despite exhaustion, continues to study complex material on rocket propulsion, demonstrating dedication and intellectual effort.
Shows no hesitation or avoidance when faced with difficult training and assignments, maintaining focus.
Elliot turns to Neil and says 'We're backup. Gemini 5.' Neil is unfazed and doesn't check the list, showing a calm acceptance.
Neil eats alone at the dinner table, distant and possibly upset about the backup assignment, but shares a light moment with Janet about orbital mechanics, smiling at her reaction.
Shows interest and understanding in orbital mechanics, explaining the concept confidently and accurately.
Remains unfazed and distant after being assigned as backup rather than primary crew, not showing frustration or confusion.
Urgently wakes family members and directs them to safety during a house fire, rescues the baby from the nursery despite smoke and flames.
Notices smoke, immediately instructs to call fire department, acts quickly to evacuate family members including a baby from a burning house despite smoke and fire.
Rushes to help family members during a dangerous fire, handing the baby to Janet and then going back inside to rescue Rick despite the risk.
Pushes through smoke and fire to rescue family members, uses a wet towel to protect himself, crawls on hands and knees through a burning house, locates and rescues his terrified child under the bed.
Freezes momentarily when overwhelmed by fear and the noise of the fire and machine, showing hesitation.
Carries Rick out of the burning house, protects him despite danger.
Speaks starkly and angrily to Rick, causing him to cry.
Moves quickly to help save the cars from the fire, showing concern for others' property.
Stares emotionless at the burning house, not comforting Janet who is distressed.
Carries Rick out of the burning house despite faltering and struggling to breathe, then immediately takes charge to help save the cars from the fire.
Pauses and struggles to catch his breath after rescuing Rick, showing physical limitation but continues to act.
Stares emotionless at the burning house after the roof collapses, showing possible emotional detachment or shock rather than proactive behavior.
Neil carefully examines the rubble and takes out a logbook to scan for clues about the fire's origin, showing attention to detail and persistence.
Does not immediately accept the fire inspector's casual explanation and continues investigating, demonstrating critical thinking and confidence.
Ed gives Neil a new smoke detector for every house in the development, showing care and thoughtfulness.
Neil shows a hint of emotion when finding the blackened bracelet but continues working diligently.
Neil responds awkwardly to Marilyn's compliment, showing modesty and sincerity.
Neil inspects the rubble thoroughly and identifies the probable cause of the fire (paneling nail).
Neil continues searching diligently for the nail despite exhaustion and inspector's exasperation.
Neil accepts the new smoke detector with surprise and gratitude, showing openness to helpful tools.
Neil describes the situation as an inconvenience and unproductive time, showing a pragmatic and realistic attitude.
Ed chuckles good-naturedly after a sarcastic comment, leading to a bond forming among the group.
Ed shoots a look at Elliot after he walks outside with beers, indicating possible irritation or disapproval.
Neil calmly verifies Elliot's sextant readings and confidently navigates star positions, showing skill and knowledge in navigation.
Neil ignores Ed's sarcastic remark and continues his work without distraction, demonstrating focus and professionalism.
Ed sarcastically questions the value of their Saturday night activity, showing some dismissiveness but also knowledge about the simulation, indicating practical competence.
Smiles at Elliot during Ed's spacewalk, showing quiet support and shared excitement.
Neil watches the EVA footage intently, showing focus and awareness of mission developments.
Neil shoots Ed a look when Ed leaves abruptly, indicating situational awareness and subtle communication.
Neil smiles at Elliot during the tense moment, showing calmness and confidence under pressure.
Pauses thoughtfully before entering the car, showing awareness and reflection.
Distracted and bemused by Ed’s warmth, momentarily losing focus on the task at hand.
Accepts command of Gemini 8 and prepares to start training with Elliot, showing readiness and confidence.
Pauses briefly when given command, indicating thoughtful consideration rather than impulsiveness.
Engages in system checks and technical discussions with engineers, demonstrating technical awareness and involvement.
Quietly studying rendezvous and docking calculations late at night, showing focus and dedication.
No direct action in this excerpt indicating a failure or lack of skill.
Stands silently with Ed after hearing about the crash, sharing a moment of awful silence without trying to deflect or minimize the tragedy.
Appears lost and distracted when his son Rick asks about the Agena, showing emotional distance and difficulty engaging with his family in a moment of grief.
Acknowledges the increased risk of being first and the technical challenges involved.
Responds to tragic news with silence and appears lost and distracted afterward.
Unable to confidently reassure his son about the Agena improvements, trailing off uncertainly.
Stands under the stars, taking readings with the sextant, practicing and jotting notes in a logbook.
Ignores Ed's greeting and continues his practice without acknowledging him.
Turns off the light and hesitates before going to bed, looks in on his sleeping children with eyes filled with tears.
Responds coldly and sharply to Ed when he suggests spending time with his family, telling him to mind his own business.
Acknowledges the difficulty of the situation realistically and refuses to pretend to know what happened with the crash, showing intellectual honesty and emotional control.
Insists on practicing docking despite emotional exhaustion and personal hardship, demonstrating dedication, focus, and professional responsibility.
Responds coldly and brusquely to Ed's concern, potentially alienating others and showing poor interpersonal skills in a stressful moment.
Hesitates before going to bed and shows emotional vulnerability by holding back tears, indicating internal struggle but also self-awareness.
Explains the concept of rendezvous to Rick and Mark clearly and patiently.
Notices Janet watching them and greets her calmly, showing awareness of others.
Demonstrates emotional control by swallowing his emotions and focusing on the task at hand (starting breakfast).
Maintains composure despite a parachute harness glitch and external tension, steeling himself to proceed.
No direct action or statement indicating problem-solving or technical skill in this excerpt.
Confidently responds 'I'm good' when asked by the Launch Director, showing calm under pressure.
Maintains composure despite elevated heart rate (146 bpm) and tense launch conditions.
No hesitation or doubt shown in communication or actions during critical pre-launch sequence.
Neil punches in roll and pitch programs under extreme G-forces and strain, maintaining control and communication.
Despite terrifying visual and physical sensations (fireball, flinching), Armstrong continues to monitor systems and communicate effectively.
Neil spots the flight book and hands it to Dave, showing situational awareness and quick response.
Neil carefully times the thruster burn and monitors instruments closely, indicating skill and precision.
Neil admits they may have overdone the thruster burn, showing self-awareness and honest assessment.
Quickly gets into position and squeezes the thruster on command, following precise instructions under pressure.
Pen slips out of hand and floats off, momentarily losing grip of a tool during a critical moment.
Focuses intently on solving a critical problem, ignoring distractions to complete complex calculations.
Does not respond to communications immediately, prioritizing problem-solving over social interaction.
Hits the thrusters at the right moment to adjust the spacecraft's trajectory, responds quickly to changing instrument readings, and successfully slows the Gemini by firing braking thrusters.
Relies on instrument readings and communicates clearly with team members, showing situational awareness and technical skill.
Successfully maneuvers the Gemini spacecraft to station keep with the Agena at about 150 feet, demonstrating precise control and calm under pressure.
Shows a lightness and ease in flying the Gemini, indicating confidence and skill in piloting.
Neil nods to Dave, coordinating the docking procedure calmly and methodically.
Neil squeezes the throttle gently, moving forward slowly to ensure a careful docking.
Neil reports clearly and confidently over comms that they are docked and the Agena is stable with no oscillations.
Follows orders quickly and works to stabilize the spacecraft during a critical situation.
Pauses and assesses the situation carefully before acting, showing thoughtful decision-making.
Grabs the throttle and attempts to disengage from the Agena despite the dangerous situation, showing decisiveness and control.
Engages thrusters to reduce roll but inadvertently causes the ship to spin faster, indicating a miscalculation or unexpected outcome.
Quickly reacts to the increasing spin rate and monitors gauges closely despite intense G forces and nausea, demonstrating situational awareness and resilience.
Remains focused and attempts to diagnose the problem despite disorienting conditions and violent tumbling.
Struggles with disorientation and near loss of consciousness, showing vulnerability under extreme stress.
Yanks breakers to cut all power quickly upon detecting thruster stuck, showing quick problem recognition and decisive action.
Searches controls frantically for a solution, spots red control and initiates RCS squibs, demonstrating situational awareness and procedural knowledge.
Commands Dave clearly and coordinates re-arming and firing of re-entry rockets despite Dave's grogginess, showing leadership and composure under pressure.
Re-entry boosters fire but spin worsens, yet Armstrong continues to battle to stabilize the ship and monitors roll rate carefully, indicating persistence and technical focus.
Momentarily struggles to keep conscious and control situation, but no indication of giving up or panic, showing resilience though some vulnerability.
Keeps calm and focused during a critical spacecraft malfunction, monitors roll rate and RCS fuel carefully, and directs crew to adjust controls to stabilize the situation.
Relies on communication with ground control and crew to verify status and fuel usage, showing situational awareness and teamwork.
Tells Jan to trust him and that they have the situation under control.
Does not respond to the Public Affairs Officer's request for a statement, avoiding engagement.
Surveys the landing area calmly and considers options despite frustration.
Acknowledges the situation realistically without futile resistance.
Ed pushes into the house with Janet, shutting the door firmly to keep the press out.
Pat is oblivious, watching TV with the kids during a tense moment.
Checks headings and helmets, prepares for retrofire manually and fires retro-rockets successfully despite communication cut out.
Struggles with locking harness, jams buckle restricting his right arm.
Keeps calm and answers technical questions clearly during the press conference despite the mission malfunction and personal discomfort.
Feels uncomfortable and nervous during the formal mission review, indicating some internal stress or doubt.
Hesitates and is not in his element when questioned repeatedly by the press, showing some discomfort and exhaustion.
Responds to an inappropriate question with humor, diffusing tension and eliciting laughter from the room.
Remains composed and silent during the formal mission review despite pressure and difficult questions.
Does not stand when others remain seated after the press conference, indicating possible social awkwardness or lack of confidence in group dynamics.
Slams down the phone in frustration after objecting to sensationalist article using his name.
Criticizes sensationalist media coverage and insists on accuracy and appropriateness of his portrayal.
Slams down the phone in frustration and walks out without resolving the issue.
Hunched over detailed technical schematics and data, actively engaged in engineering work.
Invites Ed to join him for a break despite recent tension, shares a relaxed moment with friends, laughs and shows genuine excitement for Ed's opportunity.
Studying the malfunction, working the problem to isolate a single thruster.
Acknowledges the difficulty and takes a break when needed, showing self-awareness.
Engages in casual conversation and humor with peers, maintaining good morale.
Ed reassures Neil that crashing the plane wasn’t his fault and dismisses Neil’s self-blame.
Ed smiles broadly and shares a light moment with Neil, showing friendly camaraderie.
Successfully flew many missions in Korea, demonstrating skill and experience as a pilot.
Crashes an Aeronca plane after landing hard due to distraction and lack of attention.
Reflects critically on his mistake and wishes he had prepared better, showing self-awareness and desire to improve.
Admits to being distracted after a personal loss, which negatively affected his performance.
Makes perfect pancakes for Janet despite her irritation.
Appears nervous and awkward in a tense meeting but remains respectful and cooperative.
Keeps cool under pressure during the mission, successfully docks and returns the ship home.
Appears nervous and awkward during the meeting with Gilruth and Kraft, showing some discomfort in formal or political settings.
Reluctantly agrees to represent the team at the White House despite personal reservations, showing professional acceptance of duties.
Pulls Janet back gently after she kisses his cheek, showing a tender moment of connection.
Hesitates while packing personal items, showing vulnerability and care.
Grimaces when Ed sarcastically calls him 'Hero of Gemini 8', indicating discomfort with boastful praise.
Examines lunar landing test vehicle schematics and assesses its risks realistically, recognizing its dangers.
Shows hesitation and agitation while packing, indicating possible self-doubt or anxiety.
Clings to a beer, looks uncomfortable during political discussions.
Flinches at applause and flashbulbs, showing vulnerability.
Does not engage in Pete Conrad's cynical comment about the treaty.
Appears stiff and uncomfortable in formal settings, flinches at applause and flashbulbs, clings to a beer during a political conversation.
Maintains composure enough to respond to a senator's question despite discomfort.
Quietly listens and does not engage in political banter or boastfulness; nods to bartender for a beer without drawing attention to himself.
Does not respond to Conrad’s somewhat cynical and confrontational remarks, maintaining composure.
Does not attempt to connect with the Pretty Female Staffer who approaches Neil, showing no friendliness or engagement.
Does not engage in political discussion or attempt to influence the Senator; appears awkward and out of place in the social setting.
Responds briefly and honestly when questioned by the staffer, showing no pretense or false confidence.
Acknowledges lack of knowledge about Apollo polling when confronted by Conrad.
No direct actions or statements by Armstrong in this excerpt to evaluate competence.
Stays calm and hustles through evacuation procedures during a fire in the cockpit.
Struggles to loosen a tight latch under extreme conditions but persists despite pain and danger.
No direct action or statement by Armstrong in this excerpt; presence is passive and off-scene.
Strapped into the Lunar Landing Test Vehicle, responds correctly to comms, adjusts thrusters to maintain control despite rough winds.
Breaks the phone in a rage, injuring himself and destroying property without constructive outcome.
Calmly pilots the LLTV through a dangerous, rapidly deteriorating landing situation, maintaining focus and attempting to correct the craft despite thruster failure and violent rolls.
Ignores urgent advice from Jim Lovell to bail out immediately, choosing instead to try to regain control of the craft.
Stays focused on the importance of learning from failure despite others' concerns.
Successfully ejects from the crashing LLTV and deploys parachute in time, surviving a dangerous situation.
Insists on continuing risky tests despite safety concerns, emphasizing the importance of failure for learning.
Appears somewhat dismissive of others' concerns about safety and political fallout, showing single-minded focus.
Neil studies data from his LLTV crash intently, jotting down notes and eating in a focused, efficient manner.
Neil is described as single minded, determined, and unwavering in focus despite distractions and being out of sync with his surroundings.
Neil is oblivious to social cues and the mocking behavior of others around him.
Does not directly engage in the heated speculation about mission assignments and risks, maintaining composure.
Remains silent or non-reactive when others express agitation or doubts about the mission's safety and readiness.
Remains calm and attentive during a critical and failing re-entry situation, absorbing information and tension without panic.
Does not intervene or attempt to control the failing Soyuz re-entry, possibly due to lack of direct control or authority.
Does not join in the scattered clapping and cheering after the successful launch; instead, he quietly leaves the room and methodically washes his hands, showing a reserved and introspective demeanor.
Remains methodical and concentrated, washing his hands calmly after a tense launch, showing composure and focus.
Does not outwardly celebrate or react emotionally to the successful launch, indicating a professional and controlled demeanor.
Shrugs and turns back to the sink without acknowledging the potentially momentous nature of the upcoming mission, which could be seen as a lack of outward engagement but also as steady focus.
Quietly observes Buzz Aldrin intensely studying complex lunar landing diagrams and trajectories, indicating thoughtful processing and respect for expertise.
Requests 24 hours to consider the crew assignment decision, showing prudence and careful deliberation.
Appears stiff and unemotional during the press conference, maintaining composure under pressure.
Acknowledges the group effort behind the mission, hoping the public recognizes it as such.
Responds to protest question with silence and no engagement.
Shows slight irritation at Buzz’s attempt to lighten the mood and take limelight.
Responds to reporters with brief, measured answers, showing calmness and control under pressure.
Hesitates when asked about the historical significance of the flight, showing some discomfort or difficulty articulating his thoughts.
Emphasizes the group effort rather than personal glory, indicating thoughtful and intelligent perspective on leadership and teamwork.
Says 'No' to a controversial question without elaboration, which may suggest avoidance or lack of engagement with difficult topics.
Janet forcefully grabs Neil's arm to make him talk to their children, highlighting Neil's initial emotional distance and reluctance to engage with his family before the mission.
Neil eventually sits on Rick’s bed and talks to his sons, answering their questions and addressing their worries despite his own hesitation.
Packs methodically and emotionlessly, showing preparation and focus.
Initially refuses to engage emotionally with family, prioritizing packing over talking to his children.
Shows hesitation when asked why he has to go, indicating some internal conflict or uncertainty.
Pulls out a mission briefing and starts to read attentively while in the car, showing focus and preparation.
Gives Janet only a perfunctory peck and leaves without looking back, indicating emotional distance or detachment.
Focuses intently on the checklist on his wrist despite the overwhelming presence of media and distractions.
Leads the others onto the swing arm confidently, taking charge of the situation.
Pauses and closes his eyes briefly when recognizing techs, showing a moment of internal reflection but quickly regains focus.
Neil’s thought it through, he isn’t fazed at all by the possibility of being stranded and calmly states the procedure to purge the suits and go to sleep.
Neil proceeds to checks and runs the Emergency Detection system calmly and methodically despite the claustrophobic and tense atmosphere.
Remains calm and steady with hand on abort handle during intense launch sequence.
Wills himself to focus despite violent shaking and startling conditions.
Eyes rapidly checking clock and console, maintaining situational awareness.
Follows checklist precisely, executes complex maneuvers under extreme physical stress, maintains focus on instruments despite intense g-forces and unsettling conditions.
Ignores terrifying rapid change from blue sky to black space, showing calm and confidence rather than panic.
Works a calculator calmly during a critical engine issue, provides accurate calculations and instructions to adjust the spacecraft's yaw.
Remains calm and focused despite the shaking capsule and potential engine problem, showing confidence and skill under pressure.
Does not show panic or distraction, unlike Mike who is distracted and pales at the console light flashing.
Ignores mission rules to wait for contact and starts prepping for separation independently.
Confidently operates controls and commands the maneuver despite uncertainty and silence from Houston.
Successfully pilots the CSM through a complex, precise docking maneuver after separation.
Carefully executes the docking maneuver with the lunar module, responding accurately to communication and controlling the spacecraft skillfully.
Uses a sextant to check alignment and takes readings and calculations seriously, demonstrating technical skill and focus.
Fails to notice the emotional impact of the receding Earth, focusing mechanically on tasks.
Focused intently on calculations and readings, ignoring distractions and awe-inspiring views.
Dismissive attitude toward warnings about the fuel tank and landing constraints.
Stares out the window with intense focus and resolution, studies the lunar landing map carefully even when others relax or sleep.
Abruptly tells others to sleep, showing prioritization of rest despite tension.
Nods to Mike Collins reassuringly before entering the Lunar Module, indicating trust and calmness.
Does not respond to Buzz's comment about bets and odds, remaining silent and composed.
Calmly stows his gear despite Buzz's increasing anxiety and the disorienting environment.
Nods to Mike before floating into the connecting tunnel, showing confidence and readiness.
Does not respond to Buzz's comment about bets, maintaining focus and composure.
Struggles with a loose breaker on the console but manages to fix it by pounding it back in and continues preparing for descent without hesitation.
Does not respond to Buzz's suggestion to report the breaker issue, potentially ignoring protocol.
Eases the throttle forward and lurches ahead towards the surface, pushing through fatigue and running on adrenaline.
Checks instruments carefully despite multiple alarms and distractions, maintains focus on landing.
Reacts uncharacteristically annoyed to repeated alarms but continues to fly confidently.
Ignores a third alarm and keeps flying, showing confidence and prioritization under pressure.
Makes a quick decision to switch to manual control and skillfully pilots the lunar module over a hazardous, rocky terrain despite fuel concerns.
Does not immediately respond to Buzz's questions about fuel and landing parameters, maintaining intense focus instead.
Shows intense determination and focus to complete the landing despite low fuel warnings and external advice to abort.
Ignores warnings about low fuel and continues landing despite risks, showing intense focus and determination.
Refuses to abort landing even when fuel is critically low, potentially risking mission failure or danger.
Neil (Armstrong) sits struggling to process the moment, showing deep pain and joy battling within, indicating sincere emotional depth.
Neil is meticulous and careful in preparing his suit, showing conscientiousness but not directly warmth.
Buzz jostles Neil accidentally and apologizes; Neil does not react negatively, showing tolerance and calmness.
Executes a very smooth touchdown on the lunar surface despite the intense pressure and difficulty, demonstrating skill and control.
Meticulously and carefully puts on his helmet and gloves, showing awareness of the dangers and importance of the moment.
Recovers quickly from being jostled and nearly pushed into the LM wall by grabbing the ceiling to stop himself, showing presence of mind and physical control.
Puts on his PLSS and connects the oxygen tube despite not being entirely satisfied, showing persistence and focus on the task.
Carefully climbs down the ladder to the lunar surface, maintaining focus on hands and feet, demonstrating skill and caution.
Pauses to take in the moment and reflect on the strangeness and significance of being on the lunar surface, showing emotional awareness but not detracting from task performance.
Successfully steps onto the lunar surface despite struggling emotionally and physically, delivering a memorized line under pressure.
Shows a moment of emotional overwhelm and tears, indicating vulnerability but not loss of control or failure.
Neil remains focused and calm on the lunar surface despite physical discomfort and emotional pain, showing mental resilience and situational awareness.
Neil notices the broken engine arm switch and immediately inspects it under extreme time pressure, demonstrating technical skill and presence of mind.
Neil pauses to reflect emotionally by throwing tokens into the crater, showing emotional depth but potentially risking focus during a critical mission moment.
Uses a pen to successfully trigger the engine arm mechanism under extreme time pressure, showing problem-solving and calm under stress.
Maintains focus and composure during the tense countdown and launch sequence, indicating confidence and skill.
Momentarily distracted, eyes lingering on the lunar horizon instead of fully on immediate tasks.
Nods awkwardly and gives a tight smile when complimented by the guard and escort.
Maintains composure and processes intense public attention quietly and thoughtfully after Apollo 11 mission.
Responds awkwardly but politely to praise from military escort, showing some social discomfort.
Signs a model rocket for a little girl despite being overwhelmed by the media circus.
Avoids eye contact and keeps eyes down while pressed by reporters, showing discomfort but still engaging briefly.
Pauses and awkwardly signs a model rocket for a little girl despite being overwhelmed by the media circus.
Blanches and appears overwhelmed as multiple fans call out for autographs and pictures, showing discomfort under pressure.
Nods to the crowd, acknowledging their applause despite feeling devastated and isolated.
Shows no outward enthusiasm or engagement with the gala event, appearing numb and isolated.
Maintains composure and fulfills public duties despite personal devastation and isolation.
Expresses impatience and frustration about not returning to work and space missions.
Accepts the role of a symbol and the associated limitations, showing understanding of broader responsibilities.
